clinical_study.brief_title: A Home-based Physical Activity Programme for Patients With Advanced Interstitial Lung Diseases (iLiFE)
clinical_study.official_title: iLiFE: a Home-based Physical Activity Programme for Patients With Advanced Interstitial Lung Diseases

collaborator.agency: Fundação para a Ciência e a Tecnologia

brief_summary.textblock:
Interstitial lung diseases (ILD) are a highly incapacitating group of chronic respiratory diseases, leading to disabling symptoms and impaired capacity to perform activities of daily living and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). It is known that people with ILD are highly inactive and sedentary, and in a severe stage of the disease, these people spend most of the time at home, increasing dependency on others, and decrease HRQoL. Physical activity is a cost-effective intervention, which increases the HRQoL, exercise capacity and ability to perform activities of daily living in people with chronic respiratory diseases. However, few home-based physical activity programmes are available, especially in people with ILD. Thus, it is urgent to develop innovative models of PA, closer to patients and adjusted to the patients' routines, to engage and change patients' physical activity levels, enhancing HRQoL.
iLiFE might be promising as it focuses on establishing new behaviours, within selected contexts to stimulate home-based PA. Therefore, iLiFE will be developed, implemented and evaluated in people with ILD.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical activity levels (steps/day) at 12-weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline and 12-week (immediately after iLiFE)
primary_outcome.description: Accelerometer-based activity monitors. Physical activity levels will be collected with the activity monitors GT3X+ (ActiGraph) to measure the number of steps/day.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical activity levels (steps/day) at 3 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline and 3 months after iLiFE.
primary_outcome.description: Accelerometer-based activity monitors. Physical activity levels will be collected with the activity monitors GT3X+ (ActiGraph) to measure the number of steps/day.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical activity levels (steps/day) at 6 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline and 6 months after iLiFE.
primary_outcome.description: Accelerometer-based activity monitors. Physical activity levels will be collected with the activity monitors GT3X+ (ActiGraph) to measure the number of steps/day.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical activity levels (daily energy expenditure) at 12-weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline and 12-week (immediately after iLiFE).
primary_outcome.description: Accelerometer-based activity monitors. Physical activity levels will be collected with the activity monitors GT3X+ (ActiGraph) to measure the daily energy expenditure during one week.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical activity levels (daily energy expenditure) at 3 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline and 3 months after iLiFE.
primary_outcome.description: Accelerometer-based activity monitors. Physical activity levels will be collected with the activity monitors GT3X+ (ActiGraph) to measure the daily energy expenditure during one week.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical activity levels (daily energy expenditure) at 6 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline and 6 months after iLiFE.
primary_outcome.description: Accelerometer-based activity monitors. Physical activity levels will be collected with the activity monitors GT3X+ (ActiGraph) to measure the daily energy expenditure during one week.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in health-related quality of life - St. George's Respiratory Questionnaire.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 12-week (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: St. George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) will be used to assess health related quality-of-life. The SGRQ is a comprehensive well-established 50-item questionnaire to measure health status in patients with ILD. Scores can be provided for each domain (symptoms, activities and impact) and as a total score, ranging from 0 (no impairment) to 100 (worst possible health status).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptom's impact in patients' life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: COPD Assessment Test (CAT) will be used to assess burdensome symptoms in patients' life with 8 items (cough, sputum, dyspnoea, chest tightness, capacity of exercise and home daily activities, confidence leaving home, sleep and energy levels). The scores range from 0-40, organised in 4 categories, namely <10 low impact, 10-20 medium, 21-30 high and >30 very high impact, with 5 representing the upper limit of normal in healthy non-smokers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported dyspnoea
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Patients' self-reported level of dyspnoea will be collected at rest, using the modified Borg scale. It is a 10-point scale, rated from 0 to 10, where 0 represents no breathing difficulties, and 10 maximal breathing difficulty.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quadriceps muscle strength
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Quadriceps muscle strength will be measured using a handheld dynamometer (kilogram/force).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in handgrip strength
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Handgrip strength will be measured with a dynamometer (kg).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in functional status (timed up and go test)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants' functional status will be assessed with the Timed Up and Go test, which consists in counting the time (seconds) to raise from a chair, walk 3 meters at a comfortable pace, turn, walking back and seat on the chair. Lower time indicates better performance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in exercise tolerance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Patients' exercise capacity will be assessed using the Chester step test, since it is feasible to apply at patients' home.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in emotional state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale will be used to assess symptoms of anxiety and depression. It is a 14-item questionnaire that can be subdivided in two subscales: anxiety and depression. Scores are provided for each subscale and range from 0 to 21, with higher scores meaning more symptoms of anxiety and depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the impact of breathlessness on activities of daily living
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: London Chest Activity of Daily Living will be used to assess the impact of breathlessness on activities of daily living (ADL). It is a 15-item questionnaire, subdivided in four domains: self-care, domestic, physical and leisure. A sub-total was calculated for each domain and a total score is formed by the sum of the four components' sub-totals, with high scores indicating a greater limitation to ADL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported fatigue
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Patients' self-reported level of fatigue will be collected at rest, using the modified Borg scale. It is a 10-point scale, rated from 0 to 10, where 0 represents no fatigue perception, and 10 maximal fatigue perception.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cough and sputum symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: The Cough and Sputum Assessment Questionnaire (CASA-Q) will be used to assess cough and sputum symptoms, based on their reported frequency and severity, and their impact on daily activities. It is a 20-item questionnaire containing 4 domains: cough symptoms, cough impact, sputum symptoms and sputum impact. All items are rescored and summed, achieving a score ranging from 0 to 100 for each domain, with higher scores indicating fewer symptoms or less cough and sputum impact.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in frequency of exacerbations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of exacerbations in the previous year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in healthcare utilization (number of participants that visits emergency department)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare utilization will be assessed through the number of participants that visit emergency department, in the previous year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in functional dyspnoea
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Medical Research Council scale will be used to assess functional dyspnoea related to respiratory impairment. It is a 5-point scale, rated from 0 to 4, with higher scores indicating greater breathlessness severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in functional status (short physical performance battery)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: The short physical performance battery will also be used to assess the functional status. This is a simple and easy to perform tool that includes the four-meter gait speed test, the five-repetition sit-to-stand test and a balance test, and gives a total score based on the performance in each of those tests.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in functional status (physical performance test)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: The physical performance test will be used to assess the overall functionality and evaluates multiple domains of physical function using tasks that simulate activities of daily living. This measure has 9-items with a total score of 36 points, with higher scores indicating better performance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fatigue
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: The Functional assessment of chronic illness therapy - fatigue subscale will be used to assess fatigue levels. It is multi-dimensional 13-item questionnaire assessing tiredness, weakness and difficulty in handling daily activities due to fatigue. Scores range from 0 to 52, with higher scores indicating less fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in healthcare utilization (number of visits of each participant)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare utilization will be assessed through the number of visits of each participant in the previous year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in healthcare utilization (number of hospital admissions)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare utilization will be assessed through the number of hospital admissions in the previous year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in healthcare utilization (duration of hospital admissions)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare utilization will be assessed through duration of hospital admissions in the previous year.

other_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
other_outcome.description: Patients' body mass index will be assessed in kg/m^2 based on patients' height (in meters) and weight (in kilograms).

other_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
other_outcome.description: This outcome will be assessed by the number of medications that each patient takes per day.

other_outcome.measure: Change in the dose of medication
other_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
other_outcome.description: This outcome will be assessed by the dose of medication each patient takes per day.

other_outcome.measure: Change in the frequency of medication
other_outcome.time_frame: Assessment at baseline, 4-weeks (after the programme start), 12-weeks (immediately after iLiFE), 3 and 6 months after iLiFE.
other_outcome.description: This outcome will be assessed by the frequency of medication (times/day).

arm_group.description: The experimental group will receive the iLiFE.
The control group will receive a leaflet with exercises and PA recommendations.

intervention.description: iLiFE is a 12-week individualised programme, adapted to the participants' needs and preferences. This programme will be conducted in participants' home and include everyday tasks to train endurance, balance, flexibility and strength. The intervention incudes face-to-face sessions and phone calls. Face-to-face sessions aim to adapt activities to everyday tasks, increase frequency and/or intensity, monitor progress, clarify doubts, motivate higher daily energy expenditure and manage expectations. Phone-calls aim to clarify doubts and to monitor patients' motivation/evolution, following a motivational interview. At the start of the program, the physiotherapist will be present at all sessions (3 face-to-face sessions/week), but these face-to-face visits will decrease over time. Patients will also receive a personalised manual (iLiFE manual) with activities to do in their everyday tasks.
Participants will receive a leaflet with exercises and PA recommendations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinical diagnosis of a interstitial lung disease
- clinically stable in the previous month
- ≥ 18 years old
- Living at home, assisted-home or at familiar home.
Exclusion Criteria:
- cognitive impairments
- inability to understand and co-operate
- history of neoplasic /immunologic disease or acute cardiac condition or a significant cardiac, musculoskeletal, neuromuscular or psychiatric condition
- Participating in pulmonary rehabilitation or have participated in last 6 months.
